### Project Description

For my masters thesis I will be analyzing publicly available data from the [CDC COVID Data Tracker](https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#datatracker-home) and [GISAID Data](https://covid19dashboard.regeneron.com/?tab=Variant_Graphs&subTab=Top_Variants_Over_Time_(Select_Location)). Utilizing this data, I aim to assess whether SARS-CoV-2 variant proportion data from state level surveillance can detect changes in COVID-19 case rates during a period of rising Delta variant prevalence (June 2021-December 2021), while accounting for state vaccination rates, seroprevalence, and age distribution. If effective, this could potentially be used as an indicator for surges in COVID-19 cases.

This is an ongoing project but the linked github repository has the most up to date information.

***

### Skills & Methods Utilized

* Literature Review
* Working with multiple datasets
* git
* GNU Make (planned)
* renv (planned)
* Docker (planned)
* Generalized Estimating Equations with Autoregressive Correlation Structure (planned)
